intro: Steriphe corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered starfruit, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
